item.title: 'Does Trump wear dentures?': Former US president's pronunciation sparks debate during Musk interview on X
Ukraine keeps up air attacks on Kursk as Putin lashes out at West
item.description: Ukraine conducted new drone attacks on Russia's Kursk region, destroying 12 drones. President Putin criticized the West for supporting Ukraine's incursion which seized 1,000 sq km. Ukraine's commander confirmed continued advances. Over 180,000 people evacuated from Kursk and Belgorod regions amid ongoing battles. Moscow attributed the attacks to Western intervention aimed at stalling Russian operations.

item.title: Indian American Impact mobilising support among the community for Harris
item.description: Indian American Impact, a group promoting Indian Americans in US politics, mobilized significant support for Vice President Kamala Harris's Presidential campaign. The organization implemented grassroot strategies like phone banking and canvassing in states with large Indian diasporas such as Michigan and Pennsylvania, while also raising funds and recruiting volunteers to boost voter turnout among South Asian communities.
item.dc:creator: Ishani Duttagupta

item.title: ‘Don't do it!’: What Trump told Putin regarding Ukraine

item.title: Pakistan: Met Department predicts more monsoon rains from Aug 14
item.description: The Pakistan Meteorological Department predicted more monsoon rains from August 14 to 18, affecting upper and middle areas with storms and lightning. Coastal Sindh, Punjab, and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa are expected to experience rainfall. The Met Office warned of a wetter-than-usual monsoon season, with recent heavy rains causing waterlogging in Lahore.

item.title: What is DDoS attack? Cyber assault Musk says disrupted Trump's interview on X

item.title: 'It was a hard hit’: Trump describes shooting as ‘surreal’ in Musk interview

item.title: 'Was looking in exact direction of shooter': Trump recalls assassination attempt in interview with Musk
item.description: At a rally in Pennsylvania's Bethel Park, former US President Donald Trump recounted a recent assassination attempt. He described the incident, saying he instantly recognized a bullet near his ear. Trump praised the secret service for their quick actions and the calm of the crowd. He also mentioned Corey Comperatore, who lost his life during the attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UN chief calls for Africa's permanent seat in UNSC, highlights under representation
item.description: During a recent UN Security Council debate, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres stated that the UNSC has not adapted to global changes. He advocated for a permanent seat for Africa, highlighting the undervaluation of Africa's perspectives. Dennis Francis, President of the UN General Assembly, echoed these sentiments, stressing the need for urgent reform to ensure equitable representation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris campaign targets Musk over Trump's interview on X: ‘Ruined Twitter’, now ‘controlling democracy’
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Suspected attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels targets ship in southern Red Sea, officials say
item.description: A suspected attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels targeted a ship in the Red Sea, near Hodeida, causing disruption in the crucial maritime trade route. While no immediate claims were made, the assault highlights increasing tensions linked to the Israel-Hamas conflict. The U.S. military has increased its presence in the region in response to these threats.

item.title: US elections: FBI investigates allegations of stolen Trump campaign documents in cyber attack
item.description: The FBI initiated an investigation into allegations of stolen Trump Campaign documents through a cyber attack, potentially by Iran. The campaign's claim follows a Microsoft report on foreign interference in the 2024 US election, highlighting Iranian activity. Emails containing sensitive information were reportedly leaked, raising concerns about election integrity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections 2024: Trump and Kamala’s differing ideologies offer contrasting outlooks for voters
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump offered contrasting visions while campaigning nationwide. Harris, with running mate Tim Walz, promoted optimism as 'joyful warriors.' Trump and his running mate JD Vance warned of potential challenges. Harris emphasized joyful rallies, while Trump spoke of economic concerns, engaging voters with differing tones and messages.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Musk-Trump interview key points: Former US president reveals assassination attempt details, calls Biden's exit a 'coup'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Simply false': US denies role in Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina's ouster
item.description: The White House has denied any involvement in the ousting of Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, dismissing allegations of US interference. An interim government led by Muhammad Yunus is set to oversee elections. Hasina, following her resignation, traveled to New Delhi, ending her 15-year tenure as prime minister amid student protests and opposition boycotts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
